ShortAnswerFrameworkGenerator_SyntaxSepa.response:
Bonjour! I'd be delighted to help you get started with your French journey!

The English phrase "Bonjour" is already French! "Bonjour" indeed means "Good day" or "Good morning" in English. In French, it's used as a greeting to wish someone a good day or morning.

So, if you want to say "Bonjour" in French, you can simply use the word "Bonjour" (pronounced "bone-JOOR"). It's a great way to start your conversation, and the French will appreciate your effort to speak their language!

Here are a few more basic phrases to get you started:

* Au revoir (oh-reh-VWAHR) - Goodbye
* Merci (MER-see) - Thank you
* S'il vous plaît (see voo play) - Please
* Désolé(e) (duh-soh-LAY) - Sorry
* Comment ça va? (koh-mohn sah vah) - How are you?
* Je m'appelle (zhuh mah-pehl) - My name is

Feel free to ask me any questions or practice your French with me anytime!
